intro: Brassica purpurascens, commonly known as the purple sprouting broccoli, is a member of the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, compact inflorescence of small, cabbage-like buds that turn a deep purple as they mature. The plant typically grows to a height of 60–100 cm and has dark green, lobed leaves. It thrives in cool climates and is often cultivated for its edible florets and tender stems. The plant is known for its nutritional value, containing high levels of vitamins C and K.
